alert.note: Alert for Lynn; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 03 at 1:35AM CDT until October 03 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN LYNN AND SOUTHEASTERN TERRY COUNTIES... At 135 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated an additional round of slow-moving thunderstorms producing heavy rain entering the warned area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Moore, US-380 between Tahoka and Brownfield, and TX-137 between Brownfield and Welch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
